Header: Fifth International Airport is in Jaffna
Content: Palali Airport in Jaffna has been reinstated as the Jaffna International Airport making it the third international airport in Sri Lanka and bringing the total number of international airports in the country to five. The Palali Airport has been named as the Jaffna International Airport with the approval of a proposal submitted to the Cabinet by Minister Armjuna Ranatunge. Development of the Airport which operate as a regional airport as an International Airport commenced last July. The development work is due to be completed on the 10th of this month. Operation of international flights is slated to commence soon. Four international Airports namely the Katunayake, Ratmalana, Batticaloa and Mattala Airports are operating at present.
